title: Erdős Problem #636

overview.problemStatement: Suppose G" role="presentation" style="position: relative;">GGG is a graph on n" role="presentation" style="position: relative;">nnn vertices which contains no complete graph or independent set on ≫log⁡n" role="presentation" style="position: relative;">≫logn≫log⁡n\gg \log n many vertices. Must G" role="presentation" style="position: relative;">GGG contain ≫n5/2" role="presentation" style="position: relative;">≫n5/2≫n5/2\gg n^{5/2} induced subgraphs which pairwise differ in either the number of vertices or the number of edges?
